title: If Only You Would Change : What to Do When Your Marriage Is Not What You Thought It Would Be
features: Resentment can break down trust and intimacy within your marriage, hindering the growth of your relationship. With this in mind, Mark Luciano and Father Christopher Merris have developed a Bible-based, twelve-step plan that helps each partner move beyond resentment. These twelve steps, adapted for Troubled Couples Anonymous, work with interactive exercises and personal stories to encourage and motivate you as you learn how to overcome resentment and restore genuine, lasting health to your marriage.
description: "Dr. Luciano and Fr.Merris suggest that the answer lies not in changing your partner or your needs but changing the way you go about getting your needs met..." --
STEPS The Magazine of Hope &Healing for Christians in Recovery, Spring 1993
"If Only You Would Change is brutally honest, helpful, and very hopeful. I expect this book to help many people and many marriages." --
Fr. Richard Rohr. OFM, Center for Action and Contemplation, Albuquerque, NM
"This book provides valuable tools for anyone caught in what seems to be a hopeless relationship. It is a must for all counselors, pastors and married couples." --
Reviewer: A reader from Fort Worth, Tx. January 26, 1998

It is designed to help couples or INDIVIDUALS to resolve their marriage problems using the famous 12-step self-help method. The Marriage Self Help program offers an inexpensive but a very effective alternative to marriage counseling.

Dr. Luciano has been a licensed psychologist and marriage counselor for 15 years. He has been happily married for 14 years. He and his wife Shelley have five children. Dr. Luciano and Shelley (who is a licensed therapist also) have worked with hundreds of couples in marriage and family therapy. They have witnessed incredible successes even when couples (and individuals) have come in with very difficult or longstanding marriage problems. They have specialized in helping those who have tried and failed at other marriage improvement programs. It is possible to work the Marriage Self Help program whether or not your partner is willing to participate!
